lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/chatty.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run chatty.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

* Throw any exception related to the chatbot
* When the user did not enter the details of the task
* Returns a message telling the user that the input entered is incomplete
super("The details are missing. Please check your input again");
* When user only enter the keyword without the task description
super("The command you entered is incomplete. Please give me more information.");
* if user entered a task number that does not exist
super("The task number you have entered is invalid, please double check.");
* if an input entered by user does not start with one of the command word
super("Sorry, I don't understand what that means.");
